channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024031412
item.description:
Report X-2024031412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: Parma
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Steve Schmidt Operations supervisor advised a drum of UN1487, POTASSIUM NITRATE AND SODIUMNITRITE MIXTURES, 5.1, PG II, Sitting on the dock in front of door 37 was damaged and spilled on the dock floor. Steve advised that the bottom of one drum was struck by an unknown skid and caused the spill. Ste ve stated no one on the crew advised who struck and damaged the drum causing 2lbs of the product to spill on the dock floor. Steve advised that two pounds of the product was cleaned up and placed in a recovery drum along with the damage drum and placed in the Hazmat bay. Steve advised he asked his c rew several times, who struck the drum and nobody confessed. Spill was cleaned in house.

item.title: Report E-2024030586
item.description:
Report E-2024030586

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 21, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1813 was torn in transit and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN183-impacted trailer. All waste, damaged bags, and personnel PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030605
item.description:
Report E-2024030605

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 8-ounces of "Unisol Liquid Red bK50" released from one 350-gallon metal tote leaking from the top. The source of the leak was a loose valve, which the terminal tightened. The release only impacted the exterior of the tote. ERTS reviewed the SDS and PPE requirements for material handling with the caller and determined that the terminal can clean the material that has been released. The collected waste was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report X-2024031354
item.description:
Report X-2024031354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was found on the truck with the bottom completely wet and the whole truck smelled of acetone. Package was placed in a lined tote and brought to QA where it was discovered that 1 out of the 4 gallon containers had a puncture in the bottom of it causing it to slowly leak all over the inside of the box. DescribePack: It appears there was a malfunction with the bottle containing the hazardous fluid, a puncture hole in the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined tote to prevent further leakage

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN HMPA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: AEROSOLS CANS MISSING COVER CAPS. INSUFFICIENT INNER AND OUTTER PACKAGING ALLOWING MOVEMENT OF AEROSOL CAN ALLOWED SPRAY TRIGGERS TO BREAK OFF AND LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. OUTER CARTON WAS MISSING PROPER MARKINGS. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: loose cap caused internal leakage. Package put into plastic tote to contain leak. DescribePack: loose cap caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package put into plastic tote
